abstract: For-profit college operator Education Management Corporation is expected to pay nearly $90 million to settle case, initiated by whistle-blowers, in which it was accused of compensating employees based on how many students they enrolled; civil settlement represents latest effort by federal Education Dept to crack down on fraud in for-profit college sector.
lead_paragraph: Education Management Corporation is expected to pay nearly $90 million to settle a fraud case that was brought by former employees and joined by the Justice Department and several states.

headline.main: For-Profit College System Expected to Pay Millions
headline.print_headline: For-Profit College System Expected to Pay Millions

snippet: Education Management Corporation is expected to pay nearly $90 million to settle a fraud case that was brought by former employees and joined by the Justice Department and several states.
